thread.title: Colts starting old, sick QB instead of Andrew Luck
thread.title_full: Colts starting old, sick QB instead of Andrew Luck | New York Post

author: Jonathan Lehman
title: Colts starting old, sick QB instead of Andrew Luck
text:
This is how badly Andrew Luck is messed up right now: The Colts, with their record quivering at .500, are starting a 40-year-old backup who just got out of the hospital with a virus, rather than risk their franchise quarterback.
Luck remains sidelined for Thursday night’s game against J.J. Watt and the Texans due to a shoulder injury, according to ESPN, meaning Matt Hasselbeck gets the call.
Fine, Hasselbeck led the Colts to a narrow Week 4 win over the Jaguars, except …
ESPN reported Hasselbeck was in the emergency room until 2 a.m. Tuesday being treated for a virus. That he’s still recovering from.
Hasselbeck was so sick he didn’t throw in practice this week — neither did Luck — meaning the highly possible Plan B is Josh Johnson, who was re-signed Wednesday (he was signed and dumped the previous week). Johnson couldn’t beat out rookie Bryce Petty for the Jets’ backup job coming out of training camp.
The Colts have maintained Luck has a bruised shoulder, in light of a report stating the shoulder is partially separated .
